sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Philadelphia, or, Brotherly love to the studious in the hermetick art. Wherein is discovered the principles of hermetick philosophy, with much candor and plainness. / Written by Eyreneus Philoctetes. Philoctetes, Eyreneus. Starkey, George, d. 1666.
[32], 70 p.
Printed and sold by T. Sowle at the Crooked Billet in Holy-well-lane in Shoreditch, [London] : 1694.
Sometimes attributed to George Starkey. "To the studious reader" signed: Philomathes; "To his respected and worthy friend" signed: Philetæros; at end of text signed: Eyrenaeus Philoctetes, written in the year 1691. Reproduction of original in: Christ Church Library, Oxford, England.
=======
Philadelphia, or, Brotherly love to the studious in the hermetick art. Wherein is discovered the principles of hermetick philosophy, with much candor and plainness. / Written by Eyreneus Philoctetes. Philoctetes, Eyreneus. Starkey, George, d. 1666.
[32], 70 p.
Printed and sold by T. Sowle at the Crooked Billet in Holy-well-lane in Shoreditch, [London] : 1694.
Sometimes attributed to George Starkey. "To the studious reader" signed: Philomathes; "To his respected and worthy friend" signed: Philetæros; at end of text signed: Eyrenaeus Philoctetes, written in the year 1691. Reproduction of original in: Christ Church Library, Oxford, England.
